page.title: 19BLACKMORE VALE SUMMARY
page.content: Naturally endowed with good deep soil and a reliable rainfall this land yields vast quantities of tuberculin tested milk which is collected from the farms by tankers,treated,then distibuted over a wide area. Sturminster cheese factory produces quantities of prize winning cheddar cheese and some cream and yoghurt. Besides a steady monthly milk cheque coming in the farmers can supplement their income by selling unwanted calves in the local market or by fattening calves for beef. The farmers do have problems.Many have had to sell milking cows to conform with the quota system and this reduces the number of calves available and the amount of silage needed in winter. Overall the farmer,who has to milk twice a day every day of the year,wins a fair return for his labour and skill
